medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain started at 10 PM the evening prior to presentation, initially in the LUQ, sharp, then migrated to the periumbilical and infraumbilical areas, now localized mainly in the right lower quadrant. The patient experienced nausea and vomiting, unable to keep anything down since the pain started. Took temperature at home with a high of 100.3 and had chills. Last normal bowel movement was the previous day.
medical_history.family_history: Hypertension (HTN), Diabetes Mellitus (DM), father allegedly has heart disease, no cancers.
